>>52789624
which pokemon types would be considered the hardest/ most dangerous to train? Which would be the easiest?

Which husbando has the most scars?

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52789791
(1/2)
>Normal
Rarely double typing with anything dangerous, probably good for domestic environments
>Fire
Hard to train because many have open flames or very hot bodies. Unless intelligent enough to regulate their fire not good for beginners
>Water
Seem to have a mild temperament and be easy enough to handle, especially if not evolved
>Grass
Probably still easier than fire types but Pokemon with poison attacks or thorns can be tricky
>Flying
Mostly safe like normal. Evolved forms are mostly no good for inside housing
>Fighting
Many strong willed Pokemon in this category, hard to train because they genuinely need to respect their trainer before listening to commands. High energy so need a lot of attention
>Poison
Hard to train, dangerous to humans even if they don't do it on purpose. Temperament depends highly on the exact species
>Electric
Small ones like the pika clones are very safe. Generally easy to befriend
>Ground
Like Rock they need a special environment for training. Not suitable for urban areas, otherwise mid diff to train
>Rock
Like ground the biggest challenge isn't to properly train them but more so where you find a good place to be able to do so without destroying a city
>Psychic
Second hardest to train after Dragon. Extremely intelligent so establishing yourself as the pack leader isn't enough. Also exceptionally strong. Not advised unless you have experience already
>Ice
Pretty hard. Be prepared for a lot of frost bite. Don't train in lone wilderness unless you know exactly what you are doing and that you can trust your Poke entirely

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52789951
(2/2)
>Bug
Same as Grass, but has more naturally aggressive species
>Ghost
Third most dangerous. Not beginner friendly, known to actively attack humans.
>Steel
Tie with Dark types in complexity. Steel types are mostly not flexible in the role they can take in a battle so you need to be a good strategist. Also day to day it might be an issue due to size and weight to have them around
>Dragon
Hardest to train. Big, territorial and aggressive. Intelligence varies.
>Dark
Tied with Steel. Not as inherently dangerous as the top three but can fuck you up.
>Fairy
Have very strong personalities. If it's a friendship evo you're set. If not you are screwed in most cases and will have to invest a ton of time. It's not really hard to train them but tedious and time consuming

Goldbro shares very little features with the actually popular mons. He's goofy and kinda cute but not in the "Awwww what a cute little creature!" way. He's super humanoid but he's not straight up cool like the megamans and he's certainly not a waifumon. He doesn't have a single animalistic feature (furry-ish designs attract both furries and normies, even if it's for different reasons)

He's a mix of humanoid and object Pokemon, probably two of the most disliked types of Pokemon designs. He's humanoid AND goofy. not really a combination that makes popular mons. But when you're concerned about specs of dust or micro-micro scratches? It's one of two things; autism or poorfag. I've yet to see one of these 'sleeve nazi' people post some crazy gold star or shining or ex shit, so I have to assume they're trying to protecc like $50-$100 cards. And even still, if you REALLY, REALLY wanted to protect your cards, why not just get like a screwdown or onetouch or slab, why sleeve it 4737284 times. At the end of the day they're just cards and I treat them as such and sleeve them in whatever I have available at the time
Thanks for coming to my ted talk

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52810309
This was the one thing that bothered me. In Gen 4 and 5 the NPCs are all doing different things. Black Belts spinning around, Joggers running in a circuit, Psychics responding to your key presses, Bikers riding up and down the streets etc. there was so many ways to interact with them and it made traversing routes much more interesting and challenging and made the world feel so dynamic despite the technical limitations. Hell, in Gen 7 they made it so the NPCs can spot you in different ways. Artists will occasionally look up from their picture and catch you walking past, Black Belts will spot you mid-sit up, Tourists will see you through their cameras. It just made the world feel a lot more fun and alive. Now we're back to literal Gen 1-style overworld NPCs except they don't even spin, they just stand in one spot, and you have to actually talk to them to battle. To make matters worse, they went back to giving every class the same encounter theme, and now half the NPCs are one class with slightly different characteristics.

>>52809002
Following the Leon battle and Project Mew conclusion, an episode preview appeared showing Chloe and Ash on a train together, and for once, Chloe seemed interested in what Ash was saying. Given the fact that she spent the entire series not giving a shit about Ash, coupled with her appearing bored during the Leon battle whereas Dawn was hyped to the moon, led to memes that she suddenly wanted Ash for herself since he was now famous and probably rich. These memes stated that Dawn had unintentionally cucked herself by making Chloe interested in Ash, and how Chloe's education made her more able to manipulate the situation to her benefit, and how she would "protect" Ash from being preyed upon by girls from his past, all while proceeding to milk him for all he was worth as a 100% gold digger. After a while, this was expanded upon by people who suddenly found bloomboltshipping unironically cute, largely due to Ash and Chloe's contrasting personalities (and the apparent "realistic" nature of the gold digger swooping in with minimal effort and stealing the nice guy that other girls had spent time trying to court), by having Chloe, in the midst of her gold-digging, slowly develop genuine feelings and then finally fall head over heels for Ash. This memeship initially caused both Pearlshippers and Amourshippers to get mad, but Dawnfags warmed to it and it's now an occasional humorous fixture of Dawn threads.

Imagine all the times they spent together. They knew they were special to each other, that their hearts called out for one another, but they were both just kids. Naive and inexperienced. If anyone is interested I just sleepily wrote another Dawncuck snippet for /padt/

Dawn needed the nightly calls more than anyone could imagine. Every single night, no matter how late, she stayed awake in bed, just waiting for her phone to ring. Sometimes it took until 2 or 3 o'clock, but she didn't care. The only bad days were when the call never came. She knew he was busy, but she couldn't help but cry to sleep on those lonesome, cold nights. The contests hadn't worked out for her and she felt so lost, but Ash gave her motivation.
He made her feel warm and important, like she still mattered. Everything would be okay as long as Ash was still there for her. She had no idea about Chloe.
Every night Ash would get everything he needed from his Cherry blossom, and then some. After he hung up on Dawn, he'd throw himself on Chloe. He felt bad about the times he got carried away and neglected to call, but who could blame him? When you've got everything you could ever want right in front of you just waiting, sometimes you'll just lose yourself in the moment. There's nothing like it.

>>52813133
Interesting. I meant more like:

Dawn needed the nightly calls more than anyone could imagine. Every single night, no matter how late, she stayed awake in bed, just waiting for her phone to ring. Sometimes it took until 2 or 3 o'clock, but she didn't care. The only bad days were when the call never came. She knew he was busy, but she couldn't help but cry to sleep on those lonesome, cold nights. The contests hadn't worked out for her and she felt so lost, but Ash gave her motivation.
He made her feel warm and important, like she still mattered. Everything would be okay as long as Ash was still there for her. She had no idea about Chloe.
Every night Ash would get everything he needed from his Cherry blossom, and then some. After he hung up on Dawn, he'd throw himself on Chloe. He felt bad about the times he got carried away and neglected to call, but who could blame him? When you've got everything you could ever want right in front of you just waiting, sometimes you'll just lose yourself in the moment. There's nothing like it.

Crackpot theory I had a couple months ago: what if Cliff, Arlo and Sierra were originally going to be Dakim, Ein and Venus?
They check off all the same general archetypes as a trio:
>Large, muscular male
>Smug, calculating nerd
>Femme-fatale beauty

Ein and Arlo also both share similarities in that they're both credited with the creation of the shadow pokemon. Ein, Dakim and Venus also use the Johto trio as their signature pokemon/legendaries, which would have served as a direct parallel to Spark/Candela/Blanche using the Kanto trio.
Niantic clearly knows enough about Pokemon Colosseum since they ported the concept of Shadow Pokemon exactly as it was from those games, sp I think it's plausible that they originally wanted to bring back the three Cipher Admins, and then either found out they didn't have the IP rights for the characters, or decided to just rebrand the entire concept with a Team Rocket skin for nostalgia marketability.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52784120
If you're looking for short stories/oneshots, a few ideas I had were
> Latias and Ash slip away for a quiet moment during the events of the first movie and Ash gets his first proper kiss
> Redux of the ending where Ash calls out to Latias and asks her if she wants to go (you can go either way on it)
> Ash thinks of Latias after his loss to Tobias
> Ash asks for Latias's help in the lead up to his Tobias match and we get Latias vs Latios
Anything beyond those will probably feel too OOC for Ash or Latias. He's not the person to realize he's in love and go find her.
As for *longer* stories, I want to see the "Latias joins Ash's party for a whole region" idea played straight just one time. Just one time invent a set of circumstances where he goes back for her or she finds him and they decide to take on a region together and maybe kiss a bunch. I'm very partial to that and am working on a *very* long-form version of that story, unfortunately without the kissing and also a lot more stuff piled in that'll probably turn off anyone looking for Ash and Latias to kiss.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52784274
Yeah having an extended story with Ash and Latias basically asks for one of two things. Either Ash has to stay with Latias or Ash has to go back for Latias. He would never do the former because he has his journey and his dream to follow and he really wouldn't do the latter because Ash doesn't look backwards, he barrels onwards forever in search of his dream. Journeys was basically the only time you could write in a reason for Ash and Latias to meet again, since it involves him randomly stumbling upon locations he's visited before.
Speaking as a writefag myself, it took me forever to come up with a reason Ash would go back for her, and it legitimately relied on another character begging him to take some time for himself after a string of nasty losses AND him randomly deciding on Alto Mare because he found the picture Latias gave him earlier in the story. He's never taken a vacation before in his life and only comes to a decision on that because I had to air drop a big neon sign reminding him of it.

Sacred Sword and Psycho Cut are non-negotiable choices, along with Agility ofc.
Gallade's last slot depends on your needs:
> Leaf Blade is your strongest coverage move and hits slowbro/king hard
> Knock Off is still goated and does good damage + utility
Tera wise, you have Fighting and Grass offensively (the latter with leaf blade) or Steel defensively to avoid priority and fairy moves.
EV-wise, 252 atk / 252 spe jolly allows you to wallbreak better without always needing an agility up; Life Orb gives you the biggest bang for your buck

>>52792446
To add to >>52793318 , investing in bulk is not worth it because you either become dependant on agility to do anything, or on Tera to do reasonable damage, and Gallade has the luxury of being powerful enough without boosts other than Life Orb / Muscle Band.
The third coverage move can be sword dance instead to wallbreak when the opposing team archetype demands it, but that leaves you walled by psychic types whic are still abundant.
Jolly is also the optimal nature because 80 is a crowded speed tier, but Adamant gives you a reasonable boost in power in exchange to losing to 110 speed scarfers like gengar (I would not advise to run adamant since jolly gives you the jump on positive 70/75 as well as a tonne of scarfers after an agility).
As previously mentioned Gallade is not dependant on tera which means you can tera some other mon on your team to cover dangerous threats and leave Gallade as late game option to sweep a slightly weakened team.
If using Gallade in draft leagues then the third coverage move can be literally anything since he's a green and white swiss army knife for whatever weird threat they have (on top of the fact that most of his coverage options are either sharpness boosted or above 100 bp).

Inject - Shitpost - Circlejerk

This thread is for Hacks and/or Clones. Come in and get free stuff!

Try to keep requests simple, don't ask for a thousand Pokemon at once. Injectors can only work so fast.

Keep Injections, hacks, clones, etc. in this thread please.

>Is this thread legit or not?
It is very legit. People will post here to try to tell you otherwise. Ignore them.

>No one has fulfilled my request yet? Why?
Injectors fulfill requests out of the goodness of their own hearts, and on their own time. Be patient.

>How can I help the process go faster?
Use PKHex to create .PK9 files to help Injectors quickly load in the pokemon you want. Follow the guide.
PKHeX Guide by IZIX:
https://pastebin.com/WaBxNECx

>What's the difference between this thread and Wi-Fi General?
Wi-Fi General does not condone hacks, and asking for or offering a hack over there will result in a completely unnecessary shitstorm. Play the game however you want, but if you want injections/genned Pokémon, play here in a more friendly, less autistic environment.

Requesters are free to request what they wish, but avoid bumping your request every half hour as it's only going to put people off; try giving it a few hours or more.

If someone were to so much as trace a shitty pencil drawing on top of those AI pieces, producing an inferior result but one that actually looks like a drawing, it would get nothing but praise. BUT
>This thread is for the growth of artists and those who draw for fun.
This thread is for crafting images from scratch, getting to see artists' different skill levels and unique styles, and seeing how actual human creativity translates ideas into visual media. Even a shitty drawing can accomplish that, but a masterpiece AI piece cannot. This isn't the universal image creation thread but the DRAW thread. I actually like a lot of ai art, but it doesn't belong in here

>What is it?
https://www.pokeclicker.com/
Pokéclicker is an open-source game built around the story and content of the Pokémon games. This is an idle & clicker type game that is currently in beta release phase. New content and patches are released frequently.

>Crobat?
https://crobat4.github.io/pokeclicker/
A modified version of Pokeclicker that features QoL changes from the original, including a Dock shortcut, type-based pokeball selection, Gen 3+ berries being available in dungeons, un-nerfed experience gains, and some egg-exclusive pokemon being available through other means.

Baffling to me an open source browser game in 2022 won't even allow discussion of modding while real games include mod suppport, encourage modding, or even integrate mods into their games as features. Beyond being silly, they're killing off the scriptDev-to-gameDev pipeline. You've got a niche group of people who know how to code, have spent time getting familiar with the game's code, and are invested enough in the game to write for it. They're low hanging fruit for recruitment, but if they drop into the Discord they'll find that even discussing scripts is enough to get you branded by a condescending mod. It's not just a few people either: the main script github repository has 238 forks and 144 stars compared to 247 forks and 391 stars on the games actual repo. That's a lot of developer investment to spit in the face of.

>>52811471
Its ideal to completely infect your whole collection.
If you were to infect enough, you should see the pokerus symbol on every route and dungeon that has pokemon you have caught and infected.
Getting to 50 evs on the right pokemon will turn that symbol blue on both the pokemon, and routes and dungeons if all the pokemon in them are resistant. Pretty much, Pokerus is Good if you keep your catching / passive catching.
Of course, There are pokemon that don't benefit from pokerus yet, due to being obtainable ONCE, or do not show up in the wild, wandering, shops, or evolution item results.
But, still worth infecting when the day comes they will be.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52811616
The game's FAQ from the top right corner of the screen , 3 quarters the way down the list, almost completely scrolled down in that interface says as much as you need to know about EVs.

The only thing it doesn't tell you is that the Macho Brace can only ever be equipped on a single pokemon at a time, will have to unequip it, then equip a different new one. buyable only at the Fight Area in Sinnoh post e4. For every Rowap Berry that is active in the Farm will also boost ev gains from each source, also affected by the lum berry boost, too. The multipliers stack, and you can easily get resistance if you keep the combo up.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52811914
Various evolved pokemon do end up in the wild in the later regions, however, if you can "repeat" the evolution process with an item, That will gain EVs. Some pokemon get new evolution methods in later generations that use items, Like Magnezone, Leafeon, Glaceon, In Galar, so there is lots of potential to gain evs later.
Certain baby pokemon, or pokemon that requires you to hatch another pokemon that don't show up in the wild will leave you REALLY out of luck. In Crown Tundra you will be able to find wild fossil pokemon, as reviving fossils won't give you evs either

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52798435
Step 0, upgrade your units, if you’re trying to 10k CSMM your DPS and tank should be at least Lv130 (preferably higher). Always EX your commonly used supports first for that double sync buff. Level your strong DPS pairs to 150 so they can get the job done faster.

Step 1, teambuilding, ideally your DPS should be getting to +6Atk/SpAtk +3 crit ASAP. Your third slot can either go to a debuffer/status/terrain setter if applicable, another support to heal/top up buffs, or a secondary DPS to deal with the sides faster.

Step 2, come up with a plan and know the turn order. 9 moves to the first sync = 3 moves per Pokémon, plan out these first 9 moves. Reset if necessary if you need MP regen on a trainer move to max your buffs.

Step 3, learn to quad queue, this will let you get in two syncs before the opponent’s first sync. The gist of it is, after you’ve queued nine moves, instead of immediately queuing the next two moves as they become available, you’ll want to wait for the sync countdown to reach 0, queue sync move first, then queue up moves on your other two Pokémon, then immediately queue another move after the sync finishes.

That’s basically all it takes to be “good” at this game.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Wasn't entirely sure on what rules to use for area encounters in Scarlet and Violet, but I saw that someone else used the Pokemon centers to split the Areas into smaller sections, so I went with that as well.
>Vs Katy
>Nymble
Nymble uses Struggle Bug, and Susanna strikes back with Aerial Ace. This repeats the next turn as well, with Nymble getting KO'd.
>Tarountula
Susanna hits Tarountula with Aerial Ace and gets hit with Bug Bite in return. Another Aerial Ace takes the spider out.
>Teddiursa-Tera
Susanna uses Silk Trap to slow Teddiursa down, blocking a Fury Cutter
Now faster than the bear, she hits it with Aerial Ace, and gets hit by Fury Cutter in return.
I don't want Fury Cutter to rise in power, so Silk Trap blocks the next strike.
Another Aerial Ace and Fury Cutter exchange leaves Susanna in the red, but with one final Aerial Ace, Teddiursa is defeated.

>>52717546
Starmie is really nasty, it has a +22.5% crit rate with Bubblebeam for an effective power of 65*1.5*1.8= 175bp off of 100 Special.

In RBY criticals don't do double damage, rather it's level dependent multiplier of (2*Lv+5)/(Lv+5). That means a Level 2 Rattata on Route 1 getting a critical only hits for 1.28 times damage.
I actually kind of like that, it makes the early game much less volatile, no one hit kills on an unlucky critical. And it's not like it affect competitive much since at 50 the multiplier is 1.9 and at 100 it's 1.95.

>Vs The Stony Cliff Titan (Phase One)
Greensleeves hits it with Seed Bomb, immediately triggering Anger Shell. The titan hits back with Rock Smash.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Hey friends, I've been wanting to relive the days when I actually enjoyed this fucking series, so I figured I'd do a Nuzlocke challenge like the good old days. Gonna play the era I enjoy, GBA/DS. Sort of a region-travel playthrough. FireRed, SoulSilver, Emerald, Platinum, and White.

Rules aside from the normal:
>Champion Clause: Any Pokemon, living or dead, that makes it to the HoF in one game has its line stricken from all subsequent ones. This includes split evos like Eevees or Hitmons.
>Set battle style
>Wild Pokemon and Starters randomized to within the same power level to make catches actually somewhat interesting in regions with poorly-distributed Regional Dexes

Starting off with a choice of Totodile, Pichu, or Ralts with Brock as my first gym leader makes things easy, though it does unfortunately give Boomer's rival, Zoomer, what he called "an easy dub no cap fr fr" with a two-shot Thundershock. Thankfully, I don't consider the Nuzlocke to start until after Rival 1, so here we go!

I think the Attack of my mon dropped here, but I don't recall what caused it.
The car Snarls at Sceccu(now down to 13 HP), and takes less than impressive damage from Double Kick.
I swap in Jock McGraw on Snarl.
The car lets out a Metal Sound, and Jock hits decently hard with Force Palm.
Swift sends Jock into the red, but another Force Palm does nice damage.
I send Blue Suede in on a Swift.
The Car snarls twice at the bird as it Aerial Aces. A third would kill Blue Suede, so I send in Douce Dame on on a Snarl.
A Metal Sound drops the special defense of Douce Dame far enough that I don't want to stay in after the Take Down.
I send Greensleeves in on Snarl.
Another Metal Sound is fairly meaningless, as Seed Bomb reduces the Starmobile to more or less a single point of health, which Quick Attack takes care of.
Pretty impressed with how much work the Starmobile actually had me put in.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52793062
Decided to activate the Kofu events and go to the Marinada auctions early, but I underestimated Kofu's underling Hugo, who took out Blue Suede with his Floatzel.
The fight against Iono was the last big one I did before Christmas, and boy, I completely screwed it up.
>Vs Iono
I had planned on beating her whole squad with Bulk Up Terastal Black Belt Hariyama... but somehow I forgot her first mon was
>Wattrel
Despite my mistake, I decide to double down and muscle through the bird. Jock Terastalizes as he Fakes the bird Out.
However, Air Slash does some decent damage next turn and Knock Off doesn't finish the bird off, meaning another turn of the same two moves follow, but Wattrel finally falls.
>Bellibolt
I no longer have the health or time to setup Bulk Ups, so I go directly for Force Palm. Bellibolt takes less than half, Charges up, and hits decently hard with Spark. If I don't swap Jock out, I'm losing here.
I send in Sceccu for free on Spark. Two Bulldozes deal with the frog, but not without a Water Gun crit doing nasty damage inbetween.
>Luxio
It intimidates Sceccu. A Bite does fairly insignificant damage, and two Bulldozes in a row takes out the cat.
>Lil' Lightbulb Mismagius
Sceccu almost gets reduced to red health by Hex, but gets a Strength in.
I swap in the mon I hope will be able to patch my mistakes: Ezy Rider. Hex does nothing.
Ezy Rider hits the Lightbulb with Breaking Swipe, doing really good damage. Sadly, Ezy gets hit by a Confuse Ray as well.
He hits himself, and Mismagius uses Charge Beam(SpA up!).
Another Breaking Swipe lands, putting Iono's ace into the red, but Charge Beam powers Mismagius up further.
I don't really have a safe switchin bar Sceccu(but I'm a bit frazzled at this point and his low health keeps me from picking him), so I stick with Ezy.
Sadly, he hit himself again, and the Charge Beam does just enough to down the lizard.
Douce Dame comes in to avenge him, and finishes the fight with Ice Shard.

I'm curious how many people think about the OP posts as writing prompts. Plenty of the titles, either of the image or the thread, actually point in the general direction of a less-than-obvious interpretation of the picture.

Like how this one is pointing out how Torii gates are meant to represent "crossing" from the mundane to the sacred, often with implied purification. This being from a Japanese Pixiv account, it's almost certainly more than just a literal portal, hence using "Grudges Settled" to denote interpreting it as passing on, either in the "finally gets to die" sense or just calming the fuck down.

you can catch all the gen I-IV legendaries and 8 from gen V, and they each have minigames

the updated version some redditor made updates movesets and abilities and fixes
it is easily a top 5 hack of all time, and the fact that it was made so long ago is unbelievably impressive

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52774636
>What went wrong?
Gen 1 and 2 Pokemon were designed so that they could be rendered in a 56x56 sprite on a tiny black and white screen and still be recognizable. That's why they're mostly simple shapes, that's why they're mostly based on animals and objects, that's why they have limited textures, colors and surface details.

As the technology advanced the designs became more complex and colorful. There are Pokemon now that would be impossible to accurately render under the restrictions of OG Gameboy hardware.

Again with this midwit dishonest cope of a retort.

Gen1 had a few pokemons whose designs were atypical and different, and they had those designs for a purpose.
They were meant to look "designed" or "out of place" because they are. Magnemite and Magneton were pokemons that lived in a powerplant, symbiotically with electricity. It is not explored if they are man made or not, but it is a pokemon that "evolved" to live off humanity. Same with Grimer and Muk, who it is left implied arose out of humanity's excess and pollution, to signify that pokemon and humanity are symbiotic lifeforms, even at the extremes. Then you have Mr Mime and Jynx who mimic human mannerisms, or hitmonlee and hitmon chan who copy human techniques. Or Porygon and Mewtwo to show how humanity is outright making new pokemons.

These live alongside "natural" pokemons and coexist with humanity in some trifecta of nature, pokemon and humanity. It was not fully explored in gen 1, and probably were never intended to be, it was more worldbuilding than lore or exposition. Voltorb and Electrode is another example of this, it is left to the players to deduce if pokeballs were designed of the pokemon, or if the pokemon took forms to fool humans.

1/2

>>52806473
>>52806485
Klefki is a design that could absolutely work, albeit one that would make more sense if it were placed in the context of the player searching for a key. Like imagine going through Cinnabar mansion searching for the secret key and running into weird metal key-shaped creatures that stole it or tried to trick you. That's not any more out of place than Magnemite or Voltorb.
Mostly it's a problem with execution, where Klefki could also just be randomly found in the tall grass on route 15/16 in Kalos, and slightly more sensible locations like the Lost Hotel and Thrifty Megamart don't involve any locked doors or hunting for keys where Klefki serving as a different sort of mimic could make more sense.

Vannilite would similarly be better off if it was found inside of the Cold Storage buildings rather than in the tall grass, and if its dex entries had less explained origins or implied it was much more reliant on humans for artificial cooling. These are absolutely designs that can work, they've simply been implemented improperly.

I do agree with you though that regardless of implementation, the sorts of designs that rely too much on human concepts should be the minority of designs. Gen starts you off with what are essentially just weird animals prior to the first gym, like birds, rats, and bugs.
The entire series would be very different if the Gen 1 starters were Hitmonchan, Jynx, and Mr. Mime, rather than being rare pokemon you had to go out of your way to find.

Pokémon games must be going in the right direction. One of the biggest problems of the old games was that they had too much content, and gamers now are too busy playing mobile games and Apex Legends to care about dumb post-game stuff. The difficulty also needs to keep being babyfied and having excessive handholding, like the forced Exp. Share and removing Set mode for no reason. Pokémon fans don’t want something stupid like “challenge”. They want a braindead 2-hour game their 5-year old kid can beat. Hopefully they’ll cut even more Pokémon and content from the games going forward, as that is what trusted, professional enthusiasts of the core games such as IGN desire for the series.

This is Pokémon’s fate. This is what you wanted. There is no turning back.

My theory is that someone (or possibly a group of individuals) in the dev team expected one of the new girls they were designing to end up being the basis for a new traveling companion for Ash, and they knew Gloria would be a little too generic to be the one, so they kind of overdesigned Marnie to stand out so she'd get picked. And they went with this edgy punk look to make her radically different from any previous companions. That's why Marnie is designed almost like someone's edgy OC mary sue self insert character. To be clear, I'm not saying this as a criticism, I fucking love the results it gave us. It's clear that someone really gave a damn when designing Marnie, which is more than can be said for a lot of the characters in SW/SH.

Also, I can't be the only one who looks at that necklace of hers and is reminded of the Mother Lode keys from Megaman Legends 2... can I?

Knogoats and Knogrinyu are the Chansey/Audino. You should also have the EXP Share always on, as the late-gen exp mechanics are in to allow the player to grind up new mons quicker than usual mainline games. posts.name: Anonymous

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52812616
They both are. Ghost consistently does the ACTUAL shadowmancy part of controlling darkness in the form of shadows, as though shadows were an elemental force. But the thing is, unlike basically ALL other fantasy settings, shadows and pitch black darkness/void are being treated as distinct entities in Pokémon's universe. Shadows and pitch darkness are NOT considered different forms of each other, they are distinct.

People will tell you Dark =\= Darkness because of its Japanese name, but if we're being honest that's quite squarely bullshit. Of course Dark Types are related to darkness, they're fucking BLACK, and many are nocturnal. It's not just an English thing. But the thing to understand, is that Dark Type is 95% about underhanded battle tactics and its ties to actual darkness ARE 100% THERE but they are in the background. It is extremely rare for Dark Types to ACTUALLY control darkness primarily. What's going on here is that Dark Types are doing the "Darkness is evil" trope, but 99% of the time they're just using darkness as an AESTHETIC. It's not usually part of their attacks or power set to have umbra magic.

It's not "they're creatures of darkness, so that makes them evil". It's, "they're evil, so we'll use darkness to aesthetically convey that".

>I hate how Dexit could've been solved decades in advance and Gamefreak is too geriatric to even consider solutions now.
I know this is a thread for venting and not discussion, but I am curious in how you think dexcut could've been solved decades ago.

Don't get me wrong, I hate the dexcut too.
I hate how it worsened the thing that set Pokémon apart from other RPGs.
I hate how other aspects of the games weren't compensated and improved to make up for lost Pokémon and moves.
I hate the rosterfaggotry.
I hate how the dexcut and Home have this symbiotic relationship full of scams.
I hate how we don't have the proper battle-focused side game divorced from the main low-quality RPG that incorporates the cut content into the current gen battle mechanics.
I hate how the basic features of the Pokémon gameplay experience that was once attainted in 1 or 2 games (and possibly could still be dine if it had competent devs) now have to have its own ecosystem of multiple games and apps.
I hate how the overt diehard fans defend all this when you bring up how the games are now in this unacceptable state.
Most importantly, I hate Game Freak's policy of adding a decently good feature in one game only for it to get removed in the next game in order to make that last game "feel unique" or so they claim, and if it doesn't get removed, they'll just make it worse until it finally does so the defenders can go, "It sucked anyways so I'm glad it's gone," excusing Game Freak for cutting corners.

>>52811609
Wrong, here's what you do
>Give the Unova starters the shitty elemental tackles from Gen 7 to immediately introduce type matchups
>Make the second fights with Cheren and Bianca optional (Cheren should be by backtracking to Route 1 to inspect that side area, Bianca should be on that little ledge on Route 2)
>Move Purrloin to Route 3, put Pidove, Roggenrolla, and Blitzle on Route 2 to allow the player to catch more Pokemon that have relevant type matchups
>Have the gym blocked by a guy, if you have 3 Pokemon he lets you in, if you have 2 Pokemon he forces the moneky on you, and if you have 1 Pokemon (or less to prevent crashes) he tells you to come back with 2 Pokemon
>The gym leaders now all fight you at once in a triple or rotation battle, depending on the version
For a mild inconvenience we've dramatically improved a player's overall experience with the first gym. It's not like Gen 1 or 3 levels of a good Pokemon pool, and it is a little pandering in forcing you to have more of a team and fuck up some weird challenge runs, but it should get it into the players head that overleveling your starter is not the intended way to play as well as show off a battle type that was new at the time and hasn't been seen in over a decade by the time the remakes come out.

Twinkle, a girl who dresses like a jester and loves pranks, believes in having fun over anything else. So her strategies are gimmicks and anything that amuses her. Despite this, people who pay attention will notice that she tends to favour psychic types, so maybe a Poochyena or a Purrloin that you can catch nearby can help.
The goal of this gym leader is to be both unique and a waking experience for anyone coming here. To know that, even at low-level battles, brute force will not help.
